result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose A Sanchez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: to all other sentences in 15CF217,15CF218,15CF227 and 15CF231

superMiscConds.notes:
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge.
Pay court ordered financial obligations and supervision fees.
Complete specific programming determined by the Department of Corrections.
Comply with all provisions of probation.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: all other sentences in 15CF217,15CF218, 15CF227 and 15CF231

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose A Sanchez

records.addlTxt: from S/W DOC re: requesting the Court review the amended JOC, believes the term of confinement in prison may not exceed one year and 6 months.
Partial Transcript of Sentencing Hearing

from S/W DOC re: requesting Court review JOC's. Believes the confinement does not meet the statutory requirements per Wis. Stats. 973.01(2)(b)9 which states that, "for a Class I felony, the term of confinement in prison my not exceed one year and 6 months".

records.addlTxt: 2:48 Defendant Jose A Sanchez in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Defendant Jose A Sanchez in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF217, 15CF218,15CF227 and 15CF231 heard at this time. Neither attorney has any changes. OSullivan asks for 4 years incarceration and 4 years ES. Atty Petros agrees with the PSI recommendations.  10 month jail time on each case concurrent.  Court addresses sentencing factors. Addresses course of conduct and seriousness of the offense. Court: 15CF60 3.5 years= 2 year initial confinement and  1.6 months ES, 15CF217 both counts: 4 years total: 2 years initial confinement, 2 years ES, concurrent to 15CF60. 15CF227 4 years total= 2 years initial confinement and 2 years ES. 15CF218- Ct#1 3.5 years total: 2 years initial confinement and 1 year 6 months ES -- Ct #2 4 years= 2  years initial confinement and 2 years ES. 15CF231 Ct#2  3.6: 2 years initial confinement. and 1.5 years ES. Ct#3 4 years: 2 years initial confinemant, 2 years ES.  Conditions of ES are as listed on PSI. DNA Sample 15CF60 and surcharge.  All sentences are concurrent with each other. Eligible for challenge incarceration and substance abuse programs.  8 months 18 days credit on each case.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
emailed to Atty OSullivand and Atty Petros

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def      Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  15CF60  Def pleads guilty to the amended charge Possession of meth Class I felony  Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of amended charge  15CF217  Ct 1 & 2   DEF PLEADS GUILTY to both cts. 10:17 Defendant Jose Antonio Sanchez in court, in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF217, 15CF218, 15CF227, 15CF231, 15CM56, 15CT140, 15CT143, 15TR1418 heard at this time. Def is trying to fire his 2nd public defender. Court: will not release Atty Petros until Def has another attorney or willing to waive his right to have an attorney. Def stated he has not been given his discovery. Atty Petros responds to this. Atty OSullivan states discovery was sent to Defendant's 1st attorney of record. Court urges Def to give Atty Petros another change. Get discovery exchange and get these cases back on track.
Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency and Order and a letter to the Judge signed by Def
from JA Feuerhelm to Def re: Judge reviewed Petition for Appointment of Counsel, but is not allowing Atty Petros to be released. Scheduling Conference scheduled to address.
Status conference at 02-02-2016 10:15 am.

from Wisconsin State Public Defenders Office to Defendant re: receipt of his request asking Atty Petros to be discharged from cases. Policy allows one reassignment. Defendant will need to write the Court and ask for a Court order.
